Test Description: Create cluster and 4 Mirrored Volumes of different sizes. Run Write FIO and compute the MD5Sum on volumes. Power-off Node-A. Swap drive-1 and drive-2 of Node-A and Power-on the system. Once the Node is Ready and volume attached, check the MD5Sum again on the volumes
Expected Behaviour: Slot number will change for the drive. Nodes will be UP and the MD5Sum should match

Test Description: Create cluster and 4 Volumes of different sizes. Run Write FIO and compute the MD5Sum on volumes. Power-off Node-A and Node-B. Swap drive-1 of Node-A with drive-1 of Node-B.
Expected Behaviour: Nodes should be in Not Ready state. Drives could be in Missing/Up/Foreign state depending on the order of drive discovery.

Test Description: Power-off Node-A and Node-B. Swap back drive-1 of Node-A with drive-1 of Node-B.
Expected Behaviour: Nodes should now be Ready state with all drives UP on all the nodes

Test Description: Create cluster and 4 Volumes of different sizes. Run Write FIO and compute the MD5Sum on volumes. Power-off Node-A and Node-B. Swap drive-1,2 of Node-A with drive-3,4 of Node-B.
Expected Behaviour: Nodes should be in Not Ready state. Drives could be in Missing/Up/Foreign state depending on the order of drive discovery.

Test Description: Power-off Node-A and Node-B. Swap back drive-1,2 of Node-A with drive-3,4 of Node-B.
Expected Behaviour: Nodes should now be Ready state with all drives UP on all the nodes

Test Description: Create cluster and 4 Volumes of different sizes. Run Write FIO and compute the MD5Sum on volumes. Power-off Node-A and Node-B.. Swap drive-1,2,3,4 of Node-A with drive-1,2,3,4 of Node-B.
Expected Behaviour: Nodes should be in Not Ready state. 8 Drives will be discovered. 4 will be Missing and 4 in Foreign state.

Test Description: Power-off Node-A and Node-B. Swap back drive-1,2,3,4 of Node-A with drive-1,2,3,4 of Node-B.
Expected Behaviour: Nodes should now be Ready state with all drives UP on all the nodes

Test Description: Create a 2-way mirrored volume and do Write FIO. Get the MD5Sum of the Volume. Destroy Cluster. Power-off the nodes and swap drive-1,2,3,4 on Node-A with drive-1,2,3,4 on Node-B. Power-on and Create the Cluster.
Expected Behaviour: Verify the Nodes are Ready, volumes are imported. Attach the volumes and verify the MD5Sum matches as before

Test Description: Have a 2 Node Cluster with Quorum Size as 2. Add 4 Volumes with 2-way plexes. Remove the non-quorum Node from the cluster using "dctl cluster remove" command. Move the drives from this Node to a new Node. Add the New Node to the Cluster using "dctl cluster add" command
Expected Behaviour: All the Volumes should end up showing with both the plexes. The Node-name should reflect the New-Node name for the plexes that on Drive-set that was moved to the New Node

Test Description: Have a 2 Node Cluster with Quorum Size as 2. Add 4 Volumes with 2-way plexes. Remove the non-quorum Node from the cluster using "dctl cluster remove" command. Run FIO on the remaining plexes. Move the drives from this Node to a new Node. Add the New Node to the Cluster using "dctl cluster add" command
Expected Behaviour: All the Volumes should end up showing with both the plexes. The Node-name should reflect the New-Node name for the plexes that on Drive-set that was moved to the New Node. Also, the plexes should resync and data should be consistent across plexes in a Volume

Test Description: Bringup 8 volumes on GA-1.0 Cluster and do Write FIO. Get the MD5Sum of the volumes. Destroy the Cluster. Re-Image the OS to 1.2.1 OS Image. Install the latest 1.2.1 RPM and create the Cluster
Expected Behaviour: Verify all the 8 volumes are imported and MD5Sum matches the as before. Run PODs on these volumes to verify the Volumes are usable

Test Description: Bringup 8 volumes on GA-1.0 Cluster and do Write FIO. Get the MD5Sum of the volumes. Destroy the Cluster. Re-Image the OS to 1.2.1 OS Image. Install the latest 1.2.1 RPM and create the Cluster
Expected Behaviour: Verify all the 8 volumes are imported and MD5Sum matches as before. Modify the volume to increase the number of plexes to 2 for 4 volumes and 3 for remaining 4 volumes. Verify that the new plexes resync once the Volumes are Attached

Test Description: Have a 3 Node Cluster with 2-way plexes running 1.2.0. Run FIO on the volumes and compute the MD5Sum. Cordon all the Nodes in the Cluster and upgrade the cluster to 1.2.1. Uncordon all the Nodes. All the volumes should show up with 2-way plexes. Modify the volume to plex-count 3
Expected Behaviour: The newly created plex should resync to the existing plex for all the volumes

Test Description:
Create cluster and mirrored volumes. Run fio job and calculate sha512sum.
Change the node id of one of the nodes. Reboot the node.

Create cluster and mirrored volumes. Run fio job and calculate sha512sum.
Swap node ids of two nodes. Reboot the node.
